org.latency4j

Interface AlertHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAlertHandler, MissedTargetAlertLogger, MissedTargetAlertMailer

    public interface AlertHandler

    An interface which defines the contract to which alert handlers must conform. An alert handler is invoked by a latency monitor when a monitored requirement is breached.

    The monitor will raise an alert each time the requirement is breached. These alerts are passed onto the alert handlers attached to the monitor. It is then the job of these handlers to pass the alert onto the end-target e.g. by sending a mail notification or by writing the alerts to a log file or persistent store.

    • Method Detail

      • getAlertHandlerId

        java.lang.String getAlertHandlerId()

        Returns the identifier of the handler. Each handler instance is expected to have a unique identifier.

        Returns:
        The handler's id.

      • setAlertHandlerId

        void setAlertHandlerId(java.lang.String id)

        Sets the identifier of the handler.

        Parameters:
        id - The identifier to assign to the handler. There is an implicit assumption that this value is unique. This method should be called prior to initialisation.

      • setParameters

        void setParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)

        Can be used to specify the implementation-specific parameters with which the instance should be initialised. This method should be called prior to initialisation.

        Parameters:
        parameters - The initialisation parameters.

      • init

        void init()

        Initialises the handler.

      • latencyDeviationExceededTolerance

        void latencyDeviationExceededTolerance(StatisticalLatencyRequirement requirement,
                                       WorkDuration duration,
                                       double deviationFromMean,
                                       double mean)

        Invoked by a monitor when the duration/latency of a given task has exceeded the tolerance specified in the requirement governing it. This is only applicable to statistical requirements.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement which has been breached.
        duration - The duration of the task execution which has breached the specified requirement.
        deviationFromMean - The deviation from the allowed tolerance specified in the requirement.
        mean - The average latency/duration to date for calls falling within the scope of this requirement.
        See Also:
        StatisticalLatencyRequirement

      • latencyExceededCap

        void latencyExceededCap(CappedLatencyRequirement requirement,
                        WorkDuration duration)

        Invoked when a task execution has exceeded the fixed latency cap specified in its governing requirement.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement that has been breached.
        duration - The duration of the task execution which has breached the requirement.
        See Also:
        CappedLatencyRequirement

      • workCategoryFailed

        void workCategoryFailed(LatencyRequirement requirement,
                        WorkDuration duration)

        Called by a monitor to indicate that a task failed to complete due to an exception. This method would only be invoked if error reporting is enabled for the requirement being monitored.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The latency requirement related to the failed operation.
        duration - The duration of the operation up until the point that the exception or error occurred.
